content.html:
“Uncle Berry," said James, "I want to make a mixed-fruit smoothie! I think it will taste more delicious than the other smoothies."

“Of course!” said Uncle Berry. “What fruits do you want to mix?”

“I love strawberries and mangoes!” said James, smiling at the thought of the smoothie.

“Alright,” said Uncle Berry, finding the recipe in the book. “We need to add mango puree, strawberry puree, and milk, following the picture on this page.”

 

“Now," he continued, "can you tell me what the ratio of mango puree to strawberry puree in this recipe is?”

hi.html:
“Uncle Berry,” James ne kaha, “Mujhe ek mixed-fruit smoothie banani hai! Mujhe lagta hai yeh baqi smoothies se zyadah mazedaar hogi.”

“Zarur!” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Tum kaun se phal milana chahte ho?”

“Mujhe strawberries aur aam pasand hain!” James ne kaha, smoothie ke baare mein sochkar muskuraate hue.

“Theek hai,” Uncle Berry ne kaha, kitaab mein recipe dhoondte hue. “Hamein aam, strawberry, aur doodh daalna hoga, is tasveer ko dekhte hue.”

 

“Ab,” unhone kaha, “kya tum mujhe yeh bata sakte ho ki aam se strawberry ya kya ratio is recipe mein?”

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Uncle berry aam se strawberry ka ratio chaah rahe hain. Toh tum bas un dono phal par dhyaan de sakte ho, aur doodh ko dhyaan na do. 

Phir se koshish karo!
Han, yeh sahi hai. Bahut ache!
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Yeh sawaal sirf aam aur strawberry ke ratio ke baare mein pooch raha hai, toh tumhein doodh ke baare mein jaankari ki zarurat nahin hai. Phir se koshish kariye.
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Tumne number sahi likhe hain, likin yaad rakho ki order se faraq padta hai! Phir se koshish kariye.

"That’s right!" said Uncle Berry. "For situations where we're only writing a ratio for some of the objects, you can just ignore the ones that aren’t being asked for."

James mixed the mango and strawberry purees. Then he had an idea. “Uncle Berry,” he said, “can I add blueberry puree to the smoothie?”

“Yes, of course!" said Uncle Berry. "How much do you want?”

James drew a picture of the blueberry puree on the recipe book to show Uncle Berry.

“Looks good, James!" said Uncle Berry. "Now, in your new recipe, can you find the ratio of blueberry puree to milk?”

hi.html: “Yeh sahi hai! Magar apna jawaab X:Y ki shakal mein likhna, jahan X aur Y number hain. Phir se koshish kariye.

“Sahi kaha!” kaha Uncle Berry ne. “Jab aapko sirf kuch hi cheezon ki ratio nikalni ho, aapko baqiyon pe dhyaan dene ki zarurat nahin hai.”

James ne aam aur strawberry milaye. Tab usko ek idea aaya. “Uncle Berry,” usne kaha, “kya main smoothie mein blueberry bhi daal sakta hun?”

“Han, zarur!” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Tumko kitna chahiye?”

James ne kitaab mein blueberry ki drawing banakar Uncle Berry ko dikhayi. 

 

 

“Acha lag raha hai, James! Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Ab, tumhare naye recipe mein, kya tum blueberry se doodh ka ratio dhoond sakte ho?”
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Yaad rakho ki, ek ratio mein, number sahi order mein hone chahiyen. Phir se koshish kariye.
Sahi!
Kyunki tumne blueberry se doodh ka ratio poocha hai, tumhein sirf in dono cheezen pe dhyaan dene ki zarurat hai. Tum baqi pe dhyaan na do!

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Tumhein sirf blueberry aur doodh pe dhyaan dekar baqi saare phal pe dhyaan nahin dena chahiye. 

Phir se koshish kariye. Tum kar sakte ho!

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Yaad rakhiye, tumhein bas blueberry se doodh ka ratio dhoondna hoga. Tum baqi cheezen chod sakte ho. 

Phir se koshish kariye!

content.html:
Meet James!

James is a boy who likes playing with friends and eating tasty food. We’ll follow James as he learns about ratios and how to use them.

You should know the following before going on:

  • How to add, subtract, multiply, and divide the counting numbers (1, 2, 3, 4, 5 ….)

  • How to tell whether one counting number is bigger or smaller than another.

You should also get some paper and a pen or a pencil to write with, and find a quiet place to work. Be sure to take your time and go through the story at your own pace. Understanding is more important than speed!

Once you’re ready, click Continue to get started!

hi.html:
James se milo!

James ko apne doston ke saath khelna, aur tasty khana khana pasand hai. Ham log dekhenge ki James kaise ratios seekhta aur istemaal karta hai. 

Aage badhne se pahle aapko yeh sab cheezen pata honi chahiye:

  • Counting numbers (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, …) ko add, subtract, multiply, aur divide karna

  • Yeh samajh ki ek counting number doosre counting number se bada ya chota hai

Aap paper aur pen lekar kaam karne ke liye shaant jagah bhi dhoond lo. Aapko story samajhne ke liye jitne waqt ki zarurat hai lijiye, aur sukoon se story padhiye. Samajh tezi se zyadah zaruri hai! 

Jab aap shuroo karne ke liye tayyaar ho, tab Continue click karo.

feedback.html: Well done. You found the right answer! Now James can make his smoothie :-)

hint_content.html: The question asks for four ingredients, so you should have four parts in your ratio.

content.html:
James and Uncle Berry made the mixed-fruit smoothie, and it was delicious!

“Let's just do one more for today!" said James. He pointed to a new recipe.

Uncle Berry read it out loud. “This recipe says that, for every 2 units of milk, we need 4 units of blueberry puree, 3 units of strawberry puree and 1 unit of banana puree."

“Oh no," said James. "I've had enough of banana for today. Can we take out banana puree from the recipe, and use 2 units of mango puree instead?” James asked.

“Yes, you can do that!" said Uncle Berry. "In that case, what will the ratio of milk to blueberry puree to strawberry puree to mango puree be?"

hi.html:
James aur Uncle Berry ne mixed-fruit smoothie banaya, aur woh bahut swaadisht tha!

“Bas aaj ke liye ek aur karte hain!” James ne kaha. Usne ek nayi recipe ki taraf ishara kiya. 

Uncle Berry ne recipe ko zor se padha. “Is recipe ke hisaab se, har 2 unit doodh ke liye, hamein 4 unit blueberry, 2 unit strawberry, aur 1 unit kela chahiye.”

“Oh nahin,” James ne kaha. “Aaj ke liye bahut kele kha liye. Kya ham kele ki jagah  2 unit aam instemaal kar sakte hain?” James ne poocha. 

“Han, tum yeh kar sakte ho!” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Tab phir batao, ki doodh se blueberry se strawberry se aam ka kya ratio hoga?”
Tumne doodh se blueberry se strawberry se kele ka ratio likha hai, lekin yeh sawaal kuch aur pooch raha hai. Phir se koshish kariye!
Acha kiya. Tumne sahi jawaab nikal liya hai! Ab James apni smoothie bana sakta hai :-)
Yeh sawaal tumse chaar ingredients ke baare mein pooch raha hai, toh tumhare ratio mein chaar hisse honen chahiye.
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Phir se koshish kariye - tum kar sakte ho!

content.html:
“Good job!” Uncle Berry said.

"There's just one more thing you need to know," he continued. "We can also write ratios for more than two things. So, for example, if we mix 3 liters of blueberry puree, 2 liters of banana puree and 4 liters of milk, the ratio of blueberry puree to banana puree to milk will be 3:2:4."

"Now, you try it. Can you write down the ratio of mango puree to strawberry puree to milk?"

hi.html: Tumne sirf aam aur strawberry ka ratio likha hai. Lekin sawaal dhyaan se padho — aap doodh ke baare mein bhool gaye hain! Phir se koshish kariye.

“Bahut ache!” Uncle Berry ne kaha.

“Tumhein bas ab ek aur cheez pata honi chahiye,” unhone kaha. “Ham log do se zyadah cheezon ke liye bhi ratios likh sakte hain. Toh jaise, agar ham 3 litre blueberry, 2 litre kele ka paste, aur 4 litre doodh milayenge, toh blueberry se kele se doodh ka ratio 3:2:4 hoga.”

 

“Ab tum koshish karo. Kya tum is tasveer ke hisaab se aam se strawberry se doodh ka ratio likh sakte ho?”
Tumne sirf strawberry aur doodh ka ratio likha hai. Lekin sawaal dhyaan se padho — aap aam ke baare mein bhool gaye hain! Phir se koshish kariye.
Acha kiya! Yeh sahi jawaab hai.
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Yaad rakho ki order sahi hona chahiye. Tumhara ratio sawaal mein diye order ke jaisa hona chahiye. Phir se koshish kariye.
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Phir se koshish kariye.

content.html:
Let's revise what a ratio is. Take a look at the explanation below.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A ratio expresses the relative amounts of two or more items.

For example, let's say James trades toy cars to mangoes in the ratio 1:2.

  • This means that, for every toy car he gives, he will get two mangoes in return.
  • So, if he gives 1 toy car, he will get 2 mangoes in return.
  • And, if he gives 3 toy cars, he will get 6 mangoes in return. (This still follows the ratio 1:2, because each time he gives 1 toy car, he gets 2 mangoes back.)

Notice that "1:2" only tells you the relationship between the numbers of cars and mangoes. It doesn't tell you the exact number of items that James has to trade. But if you know how many cars he trades, you can figure out the number of mangoes.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Does that make sense? Make sure you understand why James gets 6 mangoes in return when he gives 3 toy cars. When you've got it, click "Continue" to return to James and Uncle Berry!

hi.html:
Chalo ratios par ek aur nazar daalen. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ratio do aur zyadah cheezon ki relative ginti batata hai, yaani in cheezon ki ginti ek doosre ke muqaable batata hai. 

Misaal ke taur par yeh sochte hain ki James khilaune aur aam 1:2 ki ratio mein badalta hai. 

  • Iska matlab hai, usko har khilaune ke badle mein 2 aam milenge.

  • Toh, agar woh 1 khilauna dega, toh uske wapas 2 aam milenge. 

  • Aur, agar woh 3 khilaune dega, tab usko badle mein 6 aam milenge. (Yeh abhi bhi 1:2 ratio ki pairwee karega, kyunki har baar woh ek khilauna dega, usko wapas 2 aam milenge.)

Notice karo ki “1:2” tumhein khilaune aur aam ke beech ke rishte ke baare mein batata hai. Yeh tumhein yeh nahin batata hai ki James kitne samaan ki adla badli karega. Lekin agar tumhein yeh pata ho ki woh kitne khilaune dega, toh tum yeh pata laga sakte ho ki woh kitne aam ke liye badlega. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Kya tumhein yeh samajh aaya? Tumhein yeh samajh aana chahiye ki kyun James ko 6 aam milenge 3 khilaune ke badle. Jab samajh aa jaye, “Continue” dabakar James aur Uncle Berry ki taraf laut jao.

content.html:
“That’s correct!” Uncle Berry said. 

“Now, James, you can also write ratios more simply using a colon (':'), instead of the word ‘to’. So, instead of writing ‘3 to 1,’ we can write ‘3:1' instead. But you would still read it as ‘3 to 1’."

“Aha!” James said. “Let me try that out. I think I will trade 2 toy cars with 3 bananas.”

“Okay,” said Uncle Berry. “In that case, what would the ratio of toy cars to bananas be?”

(From now on, make sure to write all your ratios using a colon.)

hi.html:
“Sahi kaha!” Uncle Berry ne bola. 

“Waise, James, tum ratios ko aur asaani se bhi likh sakte ho, ek colon (‘:’) istemaal karke, ‘to’ ke bajaye. Toh, ‘3 to 1’ likhne ki jagah, ham ‘3:1’ likh sakte hain. Lekin jab isko padhoge phir bhi ‘3 to 1’ kahoge.” 

“Aha!” James ne kaha. “Chalo koshish karta hun. Main 2 toy car ke badle 3 kele badlunga.”

“Acha,” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Toh batao, is maamle mein toy car to kele ka ratio kya hoga?”

(Ab se, apne saare ratios colon se hi likhna.)

Sawaal dhyaan se padhiye! Aapke jawaab ko “X:Y” ki shakal mein hona chahiye, jahan X aur Y numbers hain. 

Phir se koshish kariye.

Nahin, yeh sahi jawaab nahin hai. Numbers ki arrangement ka dhyaan rakhiye. 

Phir se koshish kariye!

Han sahi kaha!

Bas ek cheez: jab ratios type kar rahe ho, tab number aur colon (‘:’) ke beech mein koi space nahin likhna. Jaise, tumhein “2:3” type karna chahiye, na ki “2 : 3” ya “2: 3”.

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. James kitni adla badli kar raha hai, us pe dhyaan dijiye. 

Phir se koshish kariye!

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Aapko X aur Y mein sahi numbers likhne honge taaki ratio sahi nikle. 

Phir se koshish kariye!

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Aapke jawaab ko “X:Y” ki shakal mein hona chahiye, jahan X aur Y numbers hain.

content.html:
Congratulations on completing this lesson! We hope you enjoyed making smoothies with James and Uncle Berry.

When you're ready, click on the next lesson to see what James finds out the next day!

hi.html:
Mubarak ho is lesson ko khatam karne pe! Hamein ummeed hai ki tumhein James aur Uncle Berry ke saath smoothies banane mein maza aaya hoga. 

Jab tum tayyar ho, tab agle lesson pe badh jao dekhne ke liye ki James ne agle din kya seekha!

feedback.html: Please continue.

content.html:
Uncle Berry said, “Yes, I mentioned that a ratio shows the relative relationship between different quantities. Let me explain what the word 'relative' means.”

“See these glasses? Here, the ratio of milk to mango puree is 1:2, because for any amount of milk, we need two times that amount of mango puree. If we use 1 glass of milk, we would need 2 glasses of mango puree. But, if we use 3 glasses of milk, then we would need 6 glasses of mango puree."

"The ratio doesn't tell us how many glasses of milk to use. But, if we know the number of glasses of milk, we can use the ratio to calculate the number of glasses of mango puree.”

"Ah, I get it!" said James. “So, when you say that a ratio shows the relative relationship, you mean that it doesn’t show the exact numbers, right? It just shows how much of a substance we need, relative to another substance?”

“That's correct!” Uncle Berry answered.

hi.html:
Uncle Berry ne kaha, “Han, maine kaha tha ki ratio kayi cheezon ke raqam ki beech relative rishta batata hai. Ab main tumko bataunga ki ‘relative’ lafz ka kya matlab hai.”

 

“In glasses ko dekh rahe ho? Yahan, doodh se aam ka ratio 1:2 hai, kyunki aap jitna bhi doodh lo, uske dugne aam ki zarurat hogi. Jaise, agar aap 1 glass doodh lo, toh 2 glass aam ki zarurat hogi. Lekin, agar aap 3 glass doodh lo, tab aapko 6 glass aam ki zarurat padegi.”

“Ratio hamein yeh nahin batata hai ki kitne glass doodh istemaal karen. Lekin, agar hamein yeh pata ho, toh ham ratio istemaal karke dekh sakte hain ki hamein kitne glass aam chahiye honge.”

“Oh, ab samajh aaya!” James ne kaha. “Toh, jab aap yeh kahte hain ki ratio relative relationship batata hai, toh aapka matlab hai ki woh kitne number chahiye yeh nahin batata hai, haina? Bas itna ki ek cheez ka kitna chahiye, doosre cheez ke muqaable (relative)?”

“Han sahi hai!” Uncle Berry ne kaha.

content.html:
When Uncle Berry returned home, James explained what he had done.

“Ah,” said Uncle Berry. “To make a smoothie, you need to mix the purees and milk in a certain ratio.” He gave James a recipe book. “Take a look at this book. Can you figure out what the correct ratio of milk to puree should be?”

“OK!” said James. “But how do we write a ratio of milk to puree? These are not like toys and fruits -- we cannot have 'one milk', or 'two mango purees', right?”

“That's a good question, James!” said Uncle Berry. “Well ... do you remember what I said before about ratios? What does a ratio tell us?”

hi.html:
Jab Uncle Berry ghar laute, James ne unko bataya ki usna kya kiya. 

“Ah,” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Smoothie banane ke liye tumko pise hue phal aur doodh ko sahi ratio pe milana hoga.” Unhone James ko vyanjan ki tarqeebon ki bhari kitaab di. “Is kitaab ko dekho. Kya tum samajh sakte ho ki doodh aur pise phal ka kya ratio hona chahiye?”

“Acha!” James ne kaha. “Lekin doodh se pise phal ka ratio kaise likhenge ham? Yeh khilaune aur phal ki tarah nahin hai — ‘ek doodh’, ya ‘do aam paste’ ka koi matlab nahin hota hai na?”

“Yeh acha sawaal hai, James!” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Kya tumhein yaad hai ki maine ratios ke baare mein pahle kya kaha tha? Koi ratio hamein kya batata hai?”
Yeh theek hai, lekin ek minute wapas socho ki ratio ka kya matlab hai. Ratios aayendah se istemaal aayenge, toh hamein inhein ache se samajhna chahiye.
Bahut ache!
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Yeh zaruri vishay hai, toh ek baar aur padh lo ki ratio ka kya matlab hota hai.

content.html:
“Looks like you’ll need to buy some fruit,” said Uncle Berry.

“But I don’t have any money, Uncle Berry,” said James.

Then he had an idea. “I can trade some of my toys with my friends for fruits!” he said. “They’ve always wanted to play with my toys.”

“Good idea!” said Uncle Berry. “But you won’t be trading without any rules, right? Why don’t you first decide on the ratio of toys to fruits that you want to trade at?”

hi.html:
“Lagta hai tumhein kuch phal khareedne padenge,” Uncle Berry ne kaha. 

“Lekin hamare paas paise nahin hain, Uncle Berry,” James ne kaha. 

Phir James ko ek khayaal aaya. “Ham apne doston se phal ke liye kuch khilaune badal sakte hain!” usne kaha. “Unko hamesha se hamare khilaunon se khelne ka shauq tha.”

“Acha idea hai!” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Lekin tum bina kisi niyam ke toh adla badli nahin karoge na? Pahle yeh decide kar lo ki khilaune to phal ko kis ratio pe badloge?”

content.html:
James brought the fruits home. “Look at all these fruits, Uncle Berry!” he shouted, running into Uncle Berry's room. “Let’s start making smoothies!”

Unfortunately, Uncle Berry was not in his room. He had gone to work.

So, James decided to go ahead and make a smoothie by himself. He went to the kitchen, found a blender, and started to blend each type of fruit. After James finished blending each fruit, he put the puree (i.e., the mashed-up fruit) into a bottle. But he didn’t know how to combine those purees into a delicious smoothie...

hi.html:
James phal ghar leke aa gaya. “Yeh phal dekhiye, Uncle Berry!” usne chillaya, Uncle Berry ke kamre mein daudte hue. “Chalo smoothies banana shuroo karen!”

Bad-qismati se, Uncle Berry apne kamre mein nahin the. Woh kaam ke liye nikal chuke the. 

Toh, James ne smoothi khud banane ka faisla kiya. Usne rasoi mein jaakar blender dhoonda, aur har qism ke phal ko peesa. Iske baad, usne har pise hue phal ko ek ek bottle mein daal diya. Lekin usko yeh nahin pata tha ki har pise hue phal ko kaise milayen ki ek smoothi ban jaaye.

content.html:
James sat on a sofa and thought about the smoothies he was missing out on. His uncle, Uncle Berry, walked by, and asked, “Why are you so sad, James?”

“I’d like to go to the smoothie shop, but I don’t have enough money,” James said. “Could you give me some?”

“No,” Uncle Berry said. “But, if you get some fruit, we can make a smoothie together!”

James ran to the kitchen to look for some fruit. But he couldn’t find any.

hi.html:
James sofe pe baithke haath se choote smoothies ko yaad kar raha tha. Uske uncle, Uncle Berry, ne guzarte hue poocha “Tum itne udaas kyun ho James?” 

 

“Hamein smoothie shop jaana hai lekin hamare paas itne paise hi nahin hain,” James ne kaha. “Kya aap hamein kuch paise de sakte hain?”

“Nahin,” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Lekin agar tum kuch phal le aao, toh ham dono milkar smoothie bana sakte hain!”

James kuch phal dhoondne ke liye daudte hue kitchen mein gaya. Lekin uske koi phal nahin mile.

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Aapke jawaab ko “X to Y” ki shakal mein hona chahiye, jahan X aur Y numbers hain. (Aapko quotations likhne ki zarurat nahin hai.)

content.html: A popular new smoothie shop has opened in town! James wanted to go there, but unfortunately he'd used up all his money on sweets already.

hi.html: Pados mein ek mashhur smoothie shop khuli hai! James ko wahan jaane ka dil tha, lekin usne apne saare paise mithayi pe kharch kar diye the.

feedback.html:
Correct!

We can represent the ratio as 50:20 or 5:2, because we only care about the relative amounts. Both answers are correct.

In particular, 5:2 is also correct because, every time James trades 5 marbles, he gets 2 strawberries back (and he can repeat this ten times to trade 50 marbles and get 20 strawberries back).
The ratio is correct! But, from now on, make sure to write your answer using a colon. Try again.
No, you've got the order wrong. In ratios, the order matters! Try again.
That's the correct ratio, but it needs a tiny fix: when typing ratios, you don't need to write a space before or after the colon. Can you type your answer again, without any spaces?

No, that's not correct. Check the numbers in the question carefully.

Try again!

placeholder.value: Enter your answer in the form "X:Y"

content.html:
After James decided which ratios to use for his other trades, he started trading toys with his friends.

“I’ll give you 50 marbles, and you give me 20 strawberries,” said James to one of his friends.

What is the ratio of marbles to strawberries in this trade?

hi.html: Ratio sahi hai! Lekin, ab se, apna jawaab colon ke saath hi likhna. Phir se koshish kariye.

James ne apne baqi adla badli ratios nikalkar, apne doston ke saath khilaune badalna shuroo kar diya. 

“Ham tumhein 50 kanche denge, aur tum hamko 20 strawberry dena,” James ne kaha apne ek dost se. 

Is maamle mein kanche se stawberry ka kya ratio hai?
Nahin, tumne ghalta order likha hai. Ratios mein, number ka arrangement sahi hona chahiye! Phir se koshish kariye.

Sahi! 

Ham log ratio ko 50:20 likh sakte hain ya 5:3, kyunki hamein sirf relative number ki fiqr hai. Dono jawaab sahi hain. 

5:2 sahi hai kyunki har baar James 5 kanche deta hai, usko 2 strawberries wapas milte hain (aur woh yeh kaam 10 baar sakta hai taaki woh 50 kanche dekar 20 strawberries wapas le).
Yeh sahi ratio hai, lekin ek choti cheez: jab ratio type karo, tab tumhein colon ke aaspaas space likhne ki zarurat nahin hai. Kya tum apna jawaab phir se likh sakte ho, bina kisi space ke?

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Sawaal ke number dhyaan se padho.

Phir se koshish kariye!

content.html:
“Good job, James!” said Uncle Berry. “You write 2 first and then 5, because the ratio is for marbles to oranges. The order of the numbers in the ratio is important. They should always follow the given order.”

“Now, how are you going to trade marbles for apples?” he asked.

James said,  “I am going to trade 3 marbles with 1 apple. So, the ratio of marbles to apples will be…”

Can you write down the ratio of marbles to apples?

hi.html:
Nahin, yeh sahi jawaab nahin hai. Numbers ki arrangement ka dhyaan rakhiye. 

Phir se koshish kariye!

“Bahut ache, James!” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Pahle 2 likha jaata hai aur phir 5, kyunki ratio kanche to santre ka hai.Yeh numbers ka arrangement zaruri hai. Unko hamesha isi tarah se likhna chahiye.”

 

“Ab batao, tum kanche se seb kaise badloge?” unhone poocha. 

 

James ne kaha, “Ham 3 kanchon se 1 seb badlenge. Toh, kanche to seb ka ratio hoga …” 

Kya tum kanche to seb ka ratio likh sakte ho?

Number sahi likhen hain! Bas space par dhyan do. “3” ke baad ek space hone chahiye, aur “to” ke baad ek space. 

Apna jawaab phir se likhne ki koshish kariye.

Phir se koshish kariye!

content.html:
James turned the page, and saw a recipe for banana smoothie. Yummy!

“I can make this,” he said. “We’ll need to mix milk and banana puree in the ratio ______________.”

Can you complete James’s sentence? What is the ratio of milk to banana puree?”

hi.html:
James ne page palta, aur usko kele ke smoothie ki recipe dikhi. Mazedaar! 

 

“Main yeh bana sakta hun,’ Usne kaha. “Hamein doodh aur kele ko ____________ ratio mein milana hoga.”

Kya aap James ke jumle ko poora kar sakte hain? Doodh se kele ka kya ratio hai?
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Ratio ka baaya side hamesha 1 nahin hota. Phir se koshish kariye!
Yeh achi shuruaat hai, lekin tumhare paas kela sahi raqam mein nahin hai. Phir se koshish kariye.
Sahi kaha!
Ratio ko bina space ke likha karo. Phir se koshish kariye!
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai! Phir se koshish karo. (Aur yaad rakhna ki ratio ko spaces ke bina likhna chahiye.)

feedback.html: Correct! The ratio is still 1:4, because although the glasses are bigger, we still have four times as much strawberry puree as milk.
Please write your answer as X:Y, where X and Y are numbers. Try again!

No, that's not correct. Let's say the glass of milk on the left represents 1 unit, so that your ratio is in the form 1:Y (where you need to figure out what Y is).

Can you figure out the value of Y by looking at the picture? Then, write the full ratio.

Try again!

hint_content.html: Remember, the exact amounts of milk and strawberry puree are not important. What's important is their amounts relative to each other.

content.html:
“Good job! Now, here’s another question.”

“Let’s say, instead, we need to mix milk and strawberry puree as in the picture below. The glasses here are bigger than the ones we saw before. What is the ratio of milk to strawberry puree?”

hi.html:
“Bahut ache! Ab, yeh ek aur sawaal hai.”

“Socho ki hamein doodh aur strawberry mix karna neeche ke tasveer jaise. Is mein pichli tasveer se bade glasses hain. Doodh se strawberry ka kya ratio hai?”
Apna jawaab X:Y ki shakl mein likhiye, jahan X aur Y numbers hain. Phir se koshish kariye!
Sahi! Ratio abhi bhi 1:4 hai. Halaanki glasses bade hain, hamare paas abhi bhi doodh ke chaar gunaah strawberry hoga.
Yaad rakho, doodh aur strawberry ki exact raqam zaruri nahin hai. Unki ek doosre ke relative raqam zaruri hai.

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Socho ki baany haath pe doodh ka glass 1 unit hai, toh aapko ratio 1:Y ki shakal mein likhnahoga (jahan aapko samajhna hoga ki Y kya hai). 

Kya tum tasveer ko dekhke Y kya hai nikal sakte ho? Phir, poora ratio likho. 

Phir se koshish kariye!

feedback.html: Good job!
You've got one of the answers right! But be sure to choose all correct answers. Try again.
No, that's not correct. One of your answers represents a ratio of 1:2. Try again.

No, that's not correct. Remember, a ratio does not represent the exact number. So, it's not necessarily true that there is exactly 1 piece of white chocolate.

Instead, a ratio always represents a relative relationship. So, in this case, what matters is: for every 1 piece of white chocolate, there should be 3 pieces of dark chocolate. 

See if you can use this information to figure out the answer!

No, that is incorrect.

Try again.

hint_content.html: There is more than one correct answer.
Make sure to think "relatively". For every 1 unit of white chocolate, there must be 3 units of dark chocolate.

content.html:
“Correct!” said Uncle Berry. “James, I have an idea. Do you want to make a chocolate smoothie, too? A chocolate smoothie tastes as good as fruit smoothies!”

“Of course!” James answered.

“All right,” said Uncle Berry. “The recipe here says to grind white chocolate and dark chocolate in the ratio of 1:3. See if you can pick all the pictures which represent this ratio correctly.”

hi.html:
“Sahi!” kaha Uncle Berry ne. “James, mere paas ek idea aaya. Tumhein chocolate smoothie bhi banani hai kya? Chocolate smoothies phal ke smoothies jitne ache lagte hain!”

“Aur nahin toh!” James ne jawaab diya. 


“Theek hai,” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Yeh recipe white chocolate aur dark chocolate ko 1:3 ki ratio mein pees rahi hai. Dekho agar tum woh sab tasveeren chun sakte ho jin mein yeh ratio sahi se dikhaya gaya ho.”

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Yaad rakho, ratio kisi samaan ki exact raqam nahin dikhata hai. Toh, yeh zaruri nahin hai ki white chocolate ka sirf 1 tukda hoga. 

Ratio hamesha relative rishta dikhata hai. Toh, is sawaal mein, yeh dhyaan rakho ki white chocolate ke har 1 tukde ke liye, dark chocolate ke 3 tukde hone chahiyen. 

Dekho agar tum yeh jaankari se jawaab nikal sakte ho!
Tumne ek jawaab toh sahi diya hai! Lekin phir se dekho ki tumne sab sahi jawaab chune ki nahin.
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Tumhara ek jawaab 1:2 ka ratio dikha raha hai. Phir se koshish kariye.
Bahut ache!
Ek se zyadah sahi jawaab hain.
“Relatively” socha karo. Har 1 unit white chocolate ke liye, 3 unit dark chocolate hone chahiyen.

Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. 

Phir se koshish kariye.

No, that represents a ratio of orange puree to milk that is 3:1. You want a ratio of 3:2.

It looks like you might need a quick refresher on what a ratio is. Let's go back a few steps and learn from Uncle Berry again!

No, that represents a ratio of orange puree to milk that is 1:2. But you should be choosing the image that shows a ratio of 3:2.

It looks like you might need a quick refresher on what a ratio is. Let's go back a few steps and learn from Uncle Berry again!

No, that represents a ratio of orange puree to milk of 1:3. That's not the same as what the question is asking for.

It looks like you might need a quick refresher on what a ratio is. Let's go back a few steps and learn from Uncle Berry again! Take your time, and try to really understand what he is telling James.

content.html:
“Very good!” said Uncle Berry. He looked at the kitchen table and saw that James had a jug of orange puree that hadn't been used.

“Now, James," he said, "I know a good recipe for orange smoothie. It requires mixing orange puree and milk in the ratio 3:2. Can you tell me which of the following pictures shows a 3:2 ratio of orange puree to milk?"

(Note: The orange puree is orange, and the milk is white.)

hi.html:
“Bahut ache!” Uncle Berry ne kaha. Unhone rasoi ki table ko dekha aur unko ehsaas hua ki James ke paas ek jug santre ka juice tha jo istemaal nahin hua tha. 

“Ab, James,” unhone kaha, “Mujhe santre ke smoothie ki ek achi recipe pata hai. Uske liye santre aur doodh ko 3:2 ratio mein milane ki zarurat hai. Kya tum mujhe bata sakte ho ki aage ki tasveeron mein se kaun si tasveer santre se doodh ka 3:2 ratio dikha rahi hai?”

(Dhyaan deejiye: Santre ka puree orange hai, aur doodh white.)

Nahin, yeh santre se doodh ka 3:1 ratio dikha raha hai. Tumhein 3:2 ratio ki zarurat hai. 

Shayad tumhein ratio ke matlab ko phir se dekhne ki zarurat hai. Chalo wapas chalke Uncle Berry se phir se seekhen!

Nahin yeh dikhata hai ki santre se doodh ka ratio 1:2 hai. Lekin tumko woh tasveer chunna chahiye jo 3:2 ratio dikha raha hai.

Shayad tumhein ratio ke matlab ko phir se dekhne ki zarurat hai. Chalo wapas chalke Uncle Berry se phir se seekhen!
Sahi kiya!

Nahin yeh dikhata hai ki santre se doodh ka ratio 1:3 hai. Lekin sawaal ka yeh sahi jawaab nahin hai.

Shayad tumhein ratio ke matlab ko phir se dekhne ki zarurat hai. Chalo wapas chalke Uncle Berry se phir se seekhen! Apna waqt lekar samajhne ki koshish karo ki woh James se kya kah rahe hain.
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Phir se koshish kariye, order pe dhyaan dijiye!

x: For every glass of banana puree, we need 2 glasses of milk.
For any amount of banana puree, we need twice (= 2 times) that amount of milk.
We can make this smoothie using 3 glasses of banana puree and 6 glasses of milk.

For every glass of banana puree, we need 2 glasses of milk.

feedback.html: That's a good start, but make sure to pick all the correct answers. Remember, ratios represent a relative relationship, so it's possible to have any amount of banana puree you like, as long as you have the correct amount of milk to go with it.

x: We can make this smoothie using 3 glasses of banana puree and 6 glasses of milk.

value.html: For every glass of banana puree, we need 2 glasses of milk.
For any amount of banana puree, we need twice (= 2 times) that amount of milk.
We can make this smoothie by mixing 2 cups of milk and 4 cups of banana puree.
The smoothie must contain exactly 1 glass of banana puree and 2 glasses of milk.
We can make this smoothie using 3 glasses of banana puree and 6 glasses of milk.

content.html:
"I think I understand ratios now!" said James, happily.

"Hmm, maybe you do!" said Uncle Berry. "Shall we try just one more question, to make sure?"

"Yes!" said James.

"OK," said Uncle Berry. "Do you remember that, just now, we were talking about banana smoothies? The ratio of banana puree to milk in that smoothie was 1:2. Which of the following statements describe this situation correctly? Pick all the correct ones."

hi.html:
“Mujhe lagta hai ki mujhe ratios ab samajh aa rahe hain!” James ne khushi se kaha. 

“Hhhhmm, shayad tumhein aa rahe hain!” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Kya ham bas ek aur sawaal padhen, bas hamare itmenaan ke liye?”

“Han!” kaha James ne. 


“Acha,” kaha Uncle Berry ne. “Kya tumhein yaad hai ki bas abhi ham kele ke smoothies ke baat kar rahe the? Is smoothie mein kele se doodh ka ratio 1:2 tha. In jumlon mein se kaun se is haal ko sahi se bayaan kar raha hai? Sab sahi wale chuno.”
Yeh sahi shuruaat hai, lekin tumhein sirf kuch kuch sahi jawaab mile hain. Saare sahi jawaab chuno. Phir se koshish karo!
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Yaad rakho, ratios hamesha relative rishte dikhate hain, exact raqam nahin. Uncle Berry ki baatein phir se padhte hain.
Han, yeh sahi hai! Tumne sahi kiya!

Oops, dhyaan se! Ratio mein cheezon ka order zaruri hai, lekin diye hue chunaav mein se ek aisa hai jis mein cheezen ghalat order mein likhi hain. Dhyaan rakho ki tum woh wala na chuno. 

Phir se koshish karo.

Yeh achi shuruaat hai, lekin dhyaan rakho ki sab sahi jawaab chuno. Yaad rakho, ratios relative rishte dikhaate hain, toh aap kitne bhi kele istemaal kar sakte hain, us hisaab se sahi raqam doodh bhi le lo.
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hain. Phir se koshish kariye!

feedback.html: That's correct, well done! You're really good at this!

No, that's not correct. You've included some pictures that show ratios that are not 1:6. 

Remember, ratios indicate relative relationships. So, make sure that, for every 1 unit of thing A, you have 6 units of thing B.

Try again!
Hmm, you've got some of them right, but there are more. Make sure to click all the correct answers!
No, that's not correct. Try again.

content.html: “OK, you're getting good at this!” said Uncle Berry. “This one is a little trickier. Pick all the pictures that correctly represent a ratio of 1:6.”

hi.html:
“Acha, tum is pe ache bante jaa rahe ho!” Uncle Berry ne kaha. 

“Yeh wala thoda aur mushkil hai. Woh saari tasveeren chuno jo sahi se 1:6 ka ratio dikha rahi hain.”
Yeh sahi hai, acha kiya! Tum is pe bahut ache ho!
Hhhhm, tumne kuch sahi chune hain, lekin aur bhi sahi hain. Dhyaan rakho ki tum sab sahi jawaab chun rahe ho!
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Phir se koshish karo.

Nahin yeh, sahi nahin hai. Tumne kuch aisi tasveeren chuni hain jo aise ratio dikha rahi hain jo ki 1:6 nahin hain. 

Yaad rakho, ratios relative rishte dikhate hain. Toh, dhyan rakho ki kisi cheez A ke har 1 unit ke liye, tum doosri cheez B ke 6 unit rakho. 

Phir se koshish kariye!

content.html:
James and Uncle Berry made their last smoothie for the day. It tasted fantastic! And now, because James knew about ratios, he could share the recipes with his friends, too. While cleaning the glasses, James decided that he would make more smoothies by himself tomorrow.

James also made sure to remember some important things he learned. You might want to write them down so you remember too!

  • Ratios describe the relative relationship between the amounts of different things.

  • They can be written using the word ‘to’, or using a colon. E.g. "2 to 3" or "2:3".

  • When writing a ratio, you only need to focus on the parts that are asked for. You can ignore everything else!

hi.html:
James aur Uncle Berry ne apne din ka aakhri smoothie banaya. Woh bahut swaadisht tha! Aur ab, kyunki James ko ratios ke baare mein pata tha, woh apni tarqeeben apne doston ko bhi bata sakta tha. Glass saaf karte hue James ne faisla kiya ki woh kal khud se aur smoothies banayega. 

James ne kuch zaruri cheezen bhi yaad rakhin. Tumhein yeh likh leni chahiyen taaki tumhein bhi yaad rahen! 

  • Ratios kayi cheezon ke raqamon ke beech ke relative rishte ke baare mein batata hai.

  • Woh ‘to’, ya ek colon (‘:’) ki zariye likhe jaa sakte hain. E.g. ‘2 to 3’ ya ‘2:3’. 

  • Jab ratio likho, toh tumhein sirf un cheezon pe dhyaan dena chahiye jinke baare mein poocha gaya ho. Baqi sab ke baare mein bhool sakte ho!

content.html:
“What's a ratio?” James asked, looking puzzled.

“Ah,” said Uncle Berry. “Ratios are very useful. A ratio is used to express the relative amounts of two or more things. For example, how are you planning to trade your toy cars for mangoes?”

“Well, I was going to give 1 toy car and get 2 mangoes in return,” James answered.

“OK,” said Uncle Berry. “So, you can say that you are trading toy cars and mangoes in the ratio 1 to 2. In other words, the ratio of cars to mangoes is 1 to 2.”

hi.html:
“Yeh ratio kya hota hai?” James ne hairaan hokar poocha.

“Oh,” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Ratios bahut faydah-mand hote hai. Ratio kuch cheezon ki ginti, kuch aur cheezon ke muqaable mein batati hai. Jaisi ki, tum apne khilaune phal ke liye kaise badalne wale the?”

“Ham 1 khilauna dekar 2 aam wapas lene wale the,” James ne kaha. 

“Acha,” Uncle Berry ne kaha. “Toh, tum aisa kah sakte ho ki tum khilaune aur aam 1 to 2 ki ratio mein badal rahe ho. Yaani khilaune to aam ka ratio 1 to 2 hai.”

feedback.html: Yes, that is correct!
Those are the correct numbers, but make sure to write your answer using a colon (":") from now on. Try again!
No, that's not correct. Be careful with the ordering. The question is asking about the ratio of milk to strawberry puree, but 4:1 is the ratio of strawberry puree to milk. The order matters!
No, that's not correct. Try again.

content.html: “Now," said Uncle Berry, "here is a question for you. This recipe says that we should mix milk and strawberry purees, as in the picture. What is the ratio of milk to strawberry puree?”

hi.html: “Ab,” Uncle Berry ne kaha, “mujhe is baat ka jawaab do. Is recipe ke hisaab se hamein doodh aur strawberry milana chahiye, jaise tasveer mein dikhaya gaya hai. Doodh se strawberry ka kya ratio hai?”
Yeh sahi ratio hai, lekin ek choti cheez: jab ratio type karo, tab tumhein jawab colon (“:”) istemaal karke likhna chahiye. Phir se koshish kariye!
Han, yeh sahi hai!
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Phir se koshish kariye.
Nahin, yeh sahi nahin hai. Order pe dhyaan do. Sawaal doodh se strawberry ke ratio ki baat kar raha hai, lekin 4:1 strawberry se doodh ka ratio hai. Order pe dhyaan do!

exploration.objective: Learn about how ratios can be used to show the relative relationship between quantities.
exploration.title: What is a Ratio?
